intro: Polycarpaea nivea, commonly known as the white-flowered polycarpaea, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Polycarpaea nivea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along riverbanks.
